title: How Should Gaming Improve in 2017 - Kinda Funny Gamescast Ep. 102 (Pt. 4)
description:
How should gaming improve in 2017?

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

Brian Artist Jackson, how would you like gaming to improve in 2017? Ponder that. Well, I think what I think what EA just did today is we're recording this with a release date from aspect being announced, what early two and a half months or so before the game comes out, I think is a great example of what we've been talking about - keeping your cards closer to your vest until you're ready to say something about giving people something really exciting in a finite amount of time with something that's imminent. I think it's a really cool thing we've seen, and sporadically we've also seen the opposite with what Rockstar did with Red Dead Redemption too. So that's one way I'd like to see gaming improve is to publishers take your time, developers take your time, and when there's something to say, say it.
